semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Repeated Falls vs History of Falling
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 18. Chapter 18: Symptoms, signs, and abnormal clinical and laboratory findings > d. Repeated falls

content.full_text: Code R29.6, Repeated falls, is for use for encounters when a patient has recently fallen and the reason for the fall is being investigated. Code Z91.81, History of falling, is for use when a patient has fallen in the past and is at risk for future falls. When appropriate, both codes R29.6 and Z91.81 may be assigned together. (Evidence: pg no: 76, L24-L25)
content.summary: Guidelines for distinguishing between coding recent falls under investigation versus historical falls with future risk (Evidence: pg no: 76, L24-L25)
key_concepts: Recent falls under investigation (Evidence: pg no: 76, L24)
Historical falls with future risk (Evidence: pg no: 76, L25)
Dual coding when appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 76, L25)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code R29.6, Repeated falls, is for use for encounters when a patient has recently fallen and the reason for the fall is being investigated (Evidence: pg no: 76, L24)
detailed_rules.explanation: This code is specifically for active investigation of recent fall episodes, not historical documentation (Evidence: pg no: 76, L24)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code Z91.81, History of falling, is for use when a patient has fallen in the past and is at risk for future falls (Evidence: pg no: 76, L25)
detailed_rules.explanation: This code documents historical fall risk rather than current fall investigation (Evidence: pg no: 76, L25)
